vulnerabilities.title: Babel.Locale in Babel before 2.9.1 allows attackers to load arbitrary locale .dat files (containing serialized Python objects) via directory traversal, leading to code execution.
vulnerabilities.overview: Babel.Locale in Babel before 2.9.1 allows attackers to load arbitrary locale .dat files (containing serialized Python objects) via directory traversal, leading to code execution.

vulnerabilities.title: Certain versions of Octoprint from Octoprint contain the following vulnerability: If an attacker comes into the possession of a victim's OctoPrint session cookie through whatever means, the attacker can use this cookie to authenticate as long as the victim's account exists.
vulnerabilities.overview: Certain versions of Octoprint from Octoprint contain the following vulnerability: If an attacker comes into the possession of a victim's OctoPrint session cookie through whatever means, the attacker can use this cookie to authenticate as long as the victim's account exists.

vulnerabilities.title: In the cryptography package before 3.3.2 for Python, certain sequences of update calls to symmetrically encrypt multi-GB values could result in an integer overflow and buffer overflow, as demonstrated by the Fernet class.
vulnerabilities.overview: In the cryptography package before 3.3.2 for Python, certain sequences of update calls to symmetrically encrypt multi-GB values could result in an integer overflow and buffer overflow, as demonstrated by the Fernet class.

vulnerabilities.title: python-cryptography is vulnerable to information disclosure due to the existence of a timing-based side channel. A remote attacker could potentially recover sensitive information from RSA protected communications by conducting statistical analysis.
vulnerabilities.overview: python-cryptography is vulnerable to information disclosure due to the existence of a timing-based side channel. A remote attacker could potentially recover sensitive information from RSA protected communications by conducting statistical analysis.

vulnerabilities.title: httplib2 is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to a high CPU consumption when parsing crafted headers sent by a malicious server.
vulnerabilities.overview: httplib2 is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to a high CPU consumption when parsing crafted headers sent by a malicious server.

vulnerabilities.title: httplib2 is vulnerable to HTTP request smuggling due to the improper parsing of client requests. A remote attacker could send multiple hidden requests to a server by including certain characters in the body of a request.
vulnerabilities.overview: httplib2 is vulnerable to HTTP request smuggling due to the improper parsing of client requests. A remote attacker could send multiple hidden requests to a server by including certain characters in the body of a request.

vulnerabilities.title:
Lxml contains a vulnerability that can lead to NULL pointer dereference. An attacker can exploit this flaw by supplying a crafted input and cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

**Note** This vulnerability is only applicable for installations that are used together with libxml2 **v2.9.10** through **v2.9.14**.
vulnerabilities.overview:
Lxml contains a vulnerability that can lead to NULL pointer dereference. An attacker can exploit this flaw by supplying a crafted input and cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

**Note** This vulnerability is only applicable for installations that are used together with libxml2 **v2.9.10** through **v2.9.14**.

vulnerabilities.title: lxml does not properly sanitize script content in the styling code and SVG embedded scripts. This could be exploited to run JavaScript execution attacks, such as cross-site scripting (XSS).
vulnerabilities.overview: lxml does not properly sanitize script content in the styling code and SVG embedded scripts. This could be exploited to run JavaScript execution attacks, such as cross-site scripting (XSS).

vulnerabilities.title: Lxml has a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability due to an absence of correct parameter input validation. A remote attacker could insert JavaScript code and steal a victim's session tokens, cookies, or other sensitive information.
vulnerabilities.overview: Lxml has a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability due to an absence of correct parameter input validation. A remote attacker could insert JavaScript code and steal a victim's session tokens, cookies, or other sensitive information.

vulnerabilities.title: lxml is a library for processing XML and HTML in the Python language. Prior to version 4.6.5, the HTML Cleaner in lxml.html lets certain crafted script content pass through, as well as script content in SVG files embedded using data URIs. Users that employ the HTML cleaner in a security relevant context should upgrade to lxml 4.6.5 to receive a patch. There are no known workarounds available.
vulnerabilities.overview: lxml is a library for processing XML and HTML in the Python language. Prior to version 4.6.5, the HTML Cleaner in lxml.html lets certain crafted script content pass through, as well as script content in SVG files embedded using data URIs. Users that employ the HTML cleaner in a security relevant context should upgrade to lxml 4.6.5 to receive a patch. There are no known workarounds available.

vulnerabilities.title: Python PIP is vulnerable to the installation of arbitrary revisions due to the improper handling of unicode separator characters. An attacker could cause a different git revision to be installed than what was intended by using a maliciously crafted reference field.
vulnerabilities.overview: Python PIP is vulnerable to the installation of arbitrary revisions due to the improper handling of unicode separator characters. An attacker could cause a different git revision to be installed than what was intended by using a maliciously crafted reference field.

vulnerabilities.title: python-rsa is vulnerable to information exposure due to weaknesses in processing of PKCS#1 v**1.5** ciphertext, which may allow adaptive chosen-ciphertext (Bleichenbacher) attacks. This could allow an attacker to deduce sensitive information from RSA-encrypted ciphertext using the RSA decryption API.
vulnerabilities.overview: python-rsa is vulnerable to information exposure due to weaknesses in processing of PKCS#1 v**1.5** ciphertext, which may allow adaptive chosen-ciphertext (Bleichenbacher) attacks. This could allow an attacker to deduce sensitive information from RSA-encrypted ciphertext using the RSA decryption API.

vulnerabilities.title: Python-RSA ignores zero bytes prepended to the ciphertext and decrypts it anyway. This could allow an attacker to infer that Python-RSA is being used within an application, or help manipulate the application's behaviour due to the increased ciphertext length.
vulnerabilities.overview: Python-RSA ignores zero bytes prepended to the ciphertext and decrypts it anyway. This could allow an attacker to infer that Python-RSA is being used within an application, or help manipulate the application's behaviour due to the increased ciphertext length.
